result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L Horner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: All conditions of probation shall remain the same for Extended Supervision.

miscConds.notes: Court orders repayment of restitution within the first 3 years of probation with a minimum payment of 1/36 of the full amount due.

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall have no contact with Erin School PTC or Erin Baseball Club.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant informed of DNA expungement rights.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer L Horner

Statement by Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
